name: NewYorker
text: “This is a potential public health disaster,” an infections-disease doctor wrote, of TestUtah’s attempt to disrupt coronavirus testing in the state. A pandemic, he said, “is not the time for amateurs to learn.” https://t.co/FRvOqqslA0

name: NewYorker
text: The writer, cook, and artist Tunde Wey discusses his recent essay, “Don’t Bail Out the Restaurant Industry,” and his radical vision for a more equitable culinary world. https://t.co/nPKZnvK0KI

name: NewYorker
text: By following provisions of the Mineral Leasing Act of 1920, a North Dakota company may come to control a large swath of Utah’s federal land. “The law itself is the crime—a gift to the oil and gas businesses,” @billmckibben writes. https://t.co/CIxJD3IXOy

name: NewYorker
text: Spike Lee’s new film, “Da 5 Bloods,” pulls the traumas of black men’s experiences of the Vietnam War out of obscurity and puts them in the forefront of political consciousness. https://t.co/gBMJxOMdb9

text:

name: NewYorker
text: The message of the guidelines released by the Trump Administration on Friday was amplified by its appearance on the anniversary of the largest mass murder of queer people in U.S. history. https://t.co/BRQsfhbmXW

name: NewYorker
text: The big-risk-big-reward ethos of startups is fuelled by venture capitalists who know that they won’t be the ones to go broke. https://t.co/YmByZRyhYn

name: NewYorker
text: With relatively few exceptions, the armed forces have hewed to the rule that they should never be deployed against American citizens. But President Trump has shown himself willing to trash any institution that he can’t bend to his will. https://t.co/4krc2juhLW
